title: Manta Pacific adopts Celestia, embraces native Ethereum yield - Blockworks
summary: Manta Pacific, a layer-2 network built on Optimism's OP stack, has adopted Celestia's modular data availability (DA) solution, which is expected to significantly reduce transaction costs. The shift to Celestia will make transactions cheaper by at least an order of magnitude, according to core contributor Kenny Li. Manta Pacific is also integrating zkEVM technology, which will allow for faster finality and solve the user pain point of delayed withdrawals. Additionally, Manta Pacific will offer native yield on ETH and USDC deposits through a StakeStone protocol, which supports leading staking pools and is compatible with upcoming restaking solutions.

title: Ethereum Price Key Indicators Suggest Strong Case For Correction Below $2K - NewsBTC
summary: Ethereum price is declining below $2,200, with bearish indicators suggesting a potential correction to $2,000. The coin failed to break above $2,210 resistance, and a move below $2,135 could lead to further losses. Technical indicators, such as MACD and RSI, are also bearish.

title: Solana Threatens To Unseat Ethereum In Trade Volume With $1 Billion In Single Day - NewsBTC
summary: Solana, a blockchain platform launched in 2020, has reached a significant milestone by trailing Ethereum in 24-hour decentralized exchange (DEX) volume. Solana has achieved a total decentralized exchange (DEX) volume of $1 billion in a single day, inching closer to dethroning Ethereum. This milestone has garnered attention from crypto leaders and enthusiasts, signaling a notable shift in the dynamics of decentralized finance (DeFi). Solana's success is attributed to significant purchases of Solana Mobile, high trading volumes on the dog-themed joke coin BONK, and optimistic views about the Solana ecosystem. The celebration extends beyond DEX volume triumphs, with the entire Saga Mobile inventory selling out and BONK breaking multiple records. Solana's price has also experienced a sell-off, causing a 5.65% decrease in value.

title: Ethereum Price Prediction as $ETH Faces 10% Downside Risk Below this Support - CoinGape
summary: Ethereum price is facing a 10% downside risk if it breaks below a key support level. The coin has already experienced a 10% drop from its high of $2400, and a further correction could take it down to $1920, which aligns with a 50% Fibonacci retracement level. However, a bounce back from this level could suggest that the current correction has recuperated exhausted bullish momentum, setting the stage for a potential rebound. The Global In/Out of the Money (GIOM) metric for Ethereum shows a relatively stable investor base, which could support a sustained bullish trend in the future. Additionally, the Exponential Moving Average (EMA) indicates an uptick in selling pressure within the market, and the daily RSI is hovering around the 50% mark, reflecting a neutral sentiment among traders.

title: Metis, Ethereum Layer-2 Network, Creates $100M Fund as Decentralized Sequencer Launch Nears - CoinDesk
summary: Metis, an Ethereum layer-2 network, has created a $100M fund to support the growth of its ecosystem. The fund, called the Metis Ecosystem Development Fund (MEDF), will be managed by the MetisDAO Foundation and token holders, who will decide on grant allocation and project deployment. The goal is for the fund to become self-sustaining and ensure the constant growth of the Metis ecosystem.

title: Solana DEXs momentarily outpace Ethereum amid surge in memecoin, stablecoin activity - CryptoSlate

This growth is attributed to the increasing adoption of Solana's decentralized finance (DeFi) ecosystem, particularly in the USDC stablecoin and the Bonk memecoin. Solana's blockchain-enabled Saga smartphones also sold out over the weekend, with secondary sales reaching as high as $5,000 on eBay. Meanwhile, other assets such as Helium's MOBILE token are also gaining attention from the Solana community, with its price rising 71% in the past day.

title: Ethereum Smart Contract Framework Updated to Combat Security Concerns - Cryptonews
summary: The Ethereum Smart Contract Framework has been updated to address security concerns following recent findings of security exploits on the network. The updates aim to combat security issues, such as reentrancy, which was the cause of the $3.64 million loss in the DAO hack in 2016. The EthTrust Security Levels Specification v2.0 has been released to address newly discovered bugs in the Solidity compiler and other security concerns. The specification serves as a framework for developers, organizations, and customers to review and evaluate smart contract code written in Solidity. While industry standards are important, some experts believe that repeatable, automated testing is the only way to ensure decentralized applications are adhering to best practices that prevent security exploits.

title: Ethereum (ETH) Nears Key Support, Cardano (ADA) and Rebel Satoshi ($RBLZ) Fuel Altcoin Momentum - CryptoPotato
summary:

title: Former Ethereum Developer Says 70% of ETH Supply Was Distributed During Pre-Mine - The Crypto Basic
summary: Former Ethereum developer Lane Rettig made explosive claims about the ETH ICO, alleging that 70% of the total ETH supply was distributed during the pre-mine. Rettig also revealed that the true identity of the biggest ETH holders is unknown, and that a small number of individuals may have bought up large percentages of pre-mine ETH anonymously. These allegations come after a video surfaced showing Ethereum co-founder Joseph Lubin advising early investors to create pseudonymous identities during the ICO to avoid scaring the public. Rettig, who left the Ethereum Foundation due to incidents during the pre-mine, is not the first ex-employee to make strong allegations about the ETH ICO, with former advisor Steven Nerayoff also leveling fraudulent allegations against the ETH team.

title: Ethereum: Mike Novogratz's Galaxy Digital Dumps $71 Million in ETH - U.Today
summary: Galaxy Digital, founded by Mike Novogratz, has sold $71 million worth of Ethereum through various transactions on exchanges. This comes after the company had previously sold $31 million worth of ETH. Another whale has also been observed selling Ethereum on a decentralized exchange, with 18,865 ETH sold for 42 million DAI stablecoins. Additionally, a whale withdrew 60,000 ETH from Bitfinex and borrowed 58 million DAI from Maker, then swapped the stablecoins to 58 million USDC and deposited them to Binance. Finally, several large Ethereum transactions were observed, worth almost $119 million in total.

title: Bitcoin and Ethereum set to deepen correction - FXStreet
summary: Bitcoin and Ethereum are experiencing a correction, with Bitcoin losing 1.8% and Ethereum down 2.3% in the last 24 hours. The market capitalization has reduced by 3% to $1.54 trillion. Morgan Creek Digital's Anthony Pompliano believes that BTC is following four-year market cycles and is now entering a growth phase. The bitcoin-based NFT market is expected to grow 100-fold in 2024, and the ORDI token could reach the top 30 in market capitalization. The US SEC is reviewing its approach to spot bitcoin ETFs and rejected a petition by Coinbase to develop rules for the cryptocurrency industry. Asset management companies Galaxy Digital, DWS Group, and Flow Traders are creating a subsidiary firm to issue a euro-denominated stablecoin. A new Solana-based meme token, Bonk, has risen 100% overnight after listing on Coinbase, with a capitalization of $1.7 billion.

title: Bloomberg Analyst Says the SEC Has Backed Down on Ethereum Being Security - The Crypto Basic
summary: The Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) has reportedly backed down on its stance that Ethereum is a security, according to Bloomberg ETF analyst James Seyffart. The SEC has not sued the Ethereum Foundation or publicly declared ETH as a security, despite having approved Ethereum futures ETFs. Seyffart believes that the SEC has implicitly accepted Ethereum as a commodity and will likely continue to do so, given the energy and resources required to fight against it. The SEC Chair, Gary Gensler, has picked Bitcoin and Ethereum as non-securities, and Seyffart predicts that sometime in 2024, Gensler will publicly declare Bitcoin as a commodity and remain silent on Ethereum's status, indicating that it is not a security. This would mean that Ethereum would not be subject to the same regulatory requirements as securities, such as registration, financial reporting, and disclosures with the SEC.

title: Bloomberg Analyst Says SEC Has Dismissed Ethereum as Security - Coinpedia Fintech News
summary: The SEC has reportedly dismissed Ethereum as a security, according to Bloomberg analyst James Seyffart. He suggests that the SEC's lack of action towards Ethereum indicates a shift in perspective, with the agency implicitly viewing ETH as a commodity rather than a security. This would have significant regulatory implications, as commodities are not subject to the same registration and disclosure requirements as securities. SEC Chair Gary Gensler has previously categorized both Bitcoin and Ethereum as commodities, but Seyffart predicts that Gensler will publicly label Bitcoin as a commodity in 2024 while remaining silent on Ethereum's status. The crypto industry is actively challenging the SEC's position on crypto assets' classification, with ongoing lawsuits involving Ripple and Coinbase highlighting the issue.

title: Ubisoft's 'Champions Tactics' Ethereum NFTs Generate Millions After Free Mint - Decrypt
summary: Ubisoft's new game, Champions Tactics, has generated millions of dollars in sales after offering free NFTs called Warlords. The NFTs sold out in less than 20 minutes and are now trading on secondary markets for around $600 each. The game will use the Oasys blockchain for its crypto integrations, promising a gas-free gaming experience. Those who missed out on the Warlords mint can look forward to a free Champions figure drop at a later date. The game is expected to release in 2024.

title: Ex-Ethereum developer claims 70% of ETH was pre-mined - Cryptopolitan
summary: Former Ethereum developer Lane Rettig claimed that 70% of ETH was pre-mined during the project's early stages, with the figure decreasing to around 60% recently. Rettig's comments have raised questions about the transparency and fairness of Ethereum's Initial Coin Offering (ICO). There have been ongoing debates about the lack of transparency in the distribution of ETH during its early stages, with rumors of a small number of individuals purchasing significant portions of pre-mined ETH pseudonymously. Ethereum co-founder Joseph Lubin was also involved in advising early investors to use multiple pseudonymous identities during the ICO. These allegations have challenged Ethereum's reputation and the broader perception of ICOs in the cryptocurrency industry.

title: Solana: the moment of the Ethereum-killer has arrived - The Cryptonomist
summary: Solana has surpassed Ethereum in terms of daily trading volume on decentralized exchanges (DEXs), with Solana DEX reaching $3 billion in daily trading volume while Ethereum DEX had $2 billion. This is due to the recent boom in trading on Solana's DEX, primarily driven by the Bonk token. However, Ethereum still dominates in terms of total value locked (TVL) and market capitalization. Solana is challenging Ethereum in niches where fees are a concern, such as on DEXs, as it allows for faster transactions and lower costs.
